alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 11:32AM MST until March 16 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rainfall and rain-on-snow continues along Granite Creek near Prescott. Stream gauges indicate water levels have risen over 2 feet in roughly the past 2 hours. The creek has now reached 10 feet, which is moderate flood stage. * WHERE...A portion of Yavapai County including areas in and near Prescott. * WHEN...Until 345 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Further rises in the water levels of already flooded creeks, normally dry washes, and over low water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1112 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated Rain on Snow. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Granite Creek, Miller Creek, Bannon Creek, Hassayampa River, Butte Creek and Willow Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... areas near Granite Creek in Prescott and White Spar Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 307 and 312...and between mile markers 314 and 316. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
